intro: Cacalia firma, commonly known as the hardy blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are blue to violet in color, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Cacalia firma is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
